department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: Reading Pre-Modern Hindu Narrative Literature: Seminar
course.description: Focusing on the genres of itihasa, purana, and katha, this seminar explores the relevance of both classical Indic and contemporary Euro-American literary theories for the understanding of pre-modern South Asian narrative.
course.prerequisites: Although all primary source readings will be in English translation, previous study of South Asian religions is required.
course.notes: Expected to be given in 2016-17. Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 3926.
